byline.contributor: Julfikar Ali Manik reported from Dhaka, Geeta Anand from New Delhi, and Russell Goldman from New York. Rukmini Callimachi contributed reporting from Paris.
byline.original: By JULFIKAR ALI MANIK, GEETA ANAND and RUSSELL GOLDMAN

abstract: Bangladeshi Army soldiers end 11-hour hostage situation at restaurant in Dhaka; gunmen stormed building, blew up explosive and held at least 20 people hostage; Islamic State claims responsibility for attack.
lead_paragraph: The Islamic State claimed responsibility after gunmen detonated explosives and took a number of people hostage at a restaurant in Dhaka, the Bangladeshi capital.

headline.main: Bangladeshi Troops Move to End Hostage Standoff
headline.print_headline: Bangladeshi Troops Move Against Gunmen in Hostage Crisis Linked to ISIS

snippet: The Islamic State claimed responsibility after gunmen detonated explosives and took a number of people hostage at a restaurant in Dhaka, the Bangladeshi capital....

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
